arm_group.arm_group_label: Diffusion Weighted Imaging with MRI scans
arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo a MRI (magnetic resonance imaging) scan where DWI (diffusion weighted imaging) will be performed.  Subjects will not receive contrast with this sequence, but will receive contrast as part of the standard MRI protocol.

brief_summary.textblock:
To discover new information about MRI(magnetic resonance imaging)called DWI (diffusion
      weighted imaging) and its ability to diagnose cardiac scarring.  CMR-DE (cardiac magnetic
      resonance with delayed contrast enhancement)evaluates if scarring has occurred to the muscle
      of the heart following a heart attack.  Subjects are injected with a contrast medication
      that makes the scarring visible if present. To prove the efficacy of DWI (diffusion weighted
      imaging) to provide the same images that CMR-DE (cardiac magnetic resonance with delayed
      contrast enhancement)provides.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Non Contrast DWI(Diffusion Weighted Imaging) Imaging Compared to DMR-DE

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Males and females 21 years of age and older

          -  Healthy volunteers

          -  subjects with a prior history of heart attack and prior CMR-DE imaging.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Women who are pregnant

          -  Subjects with GFR < 60 ml/min/1.73m2

          -  Subjects with ICD

          -  Subjects with coronary stents incompatible with 3T

intervention.arm_group_label: Diffusion Weighted Imaging with MRI scans
intervention.description: Subjects will have an MRI(magnetic resonance imaging)performed.  This sequence will take no longer than 10 to 15 minutes to complete.  Only DWI (diffusion weighted imaging) will be added to the standard cardiac MR protocol for viability which requires contrast injection. DWI(diffusion weighted imaging) sequence does not require contrast injection.
intervention.intervention_name: Diffusion Weighted Imaging with MRI scans

clinical_study.official_title: Prospective Study to Obtain Preliminary Data to Determine the Effi8cacyof Non Contrast DWI Imaging Compared to CMR-DE

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Confirm the efficacy of diffusion weighted imaging in providing imaging that shows cardiac scarring without the injection of contrast.
primary_outcome.measure: presence and apparent diffusion coefficient (ADC) quantification of scar on (DWI) diffusion weighted image

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
